Package oh_hecc.game_parts.passage

Class EditablePassage

java.lang.Object
oh_hecc.game_parts.passage.EditablePassage
All Implemented Interfaces:
PassageEditingInterface, PassageReadingInterface, SharedPassage, Heccable, Parseable
public class EditablePassage
extends java.lang.Object
implements PassageEditingInterface, PassageReadingInterface
Like Passage but this time it's actually Editable!

  • Field Details

    • passageUUID

      private final java.util.UUID passageUUID
      The passageUUID of this particular passage. Yes, it's a UUID. There's a stupidly low chance that multiple passages could have identical UUIDs. but, if you somehow have enough passages so that there's a collision with these, chances are that this would be the least of your concerns. Anywho, they're generated dynamically (never saved in .hecc format or in the final heccin game), so I'm not even going to give you the opportunity to set up a collision.

    • passageName

      private java.lang.String passageName
      The name of this passage

      unparsedContent - the raw content of this passage
      comment - the trailing comment for this passage
      lineEndMetadata - the metadata at the end of the declaration line

  • Method Details

    • setPassageContent

      public void setPassageContent​(java.lang.String newContent)
      This method will be used when the passage content needs to be updated indirectly. Replaces the passageContent, and updates the linkedPassages appropriately
      Specified by:
      setPassageContent in interface PassageEditingInterface
      Parameters:
      newContent - the new content that the passage now holds

    • updatePassageStatus

      private void updatePassageStatus()
      This method is used to update the 'status' of this passage. If the passage contents (still) contains a reference to a deleted passage, this is a 'DELETED_LINK' passage. If the passage contains no links to other notes, this passage is an END_NODE otherwise, it's NORMAL.

    • updatePassageContent

      public java.util.Map<java.util.UUID,​PassageEditingInterface> updatePassageContent​(java.lang.String newContent, java.util.Map<java.util.UUID,​PassageEditingInterface> allPassages)
      This method will be used when the passage content needs to be updated directly. Replaces the passageContent, and updates the linkedPassages appropriately
      Specified by:
      updatePassageContent in interface PassageEditingInterface
      Parameters:
      newContent - the new content that the passage now holds
      allPassages - the map of all passages (just in case any new passages need to be added to the map)

    • renameThisPassage

      public java.lang.String renameThisPassage​(java.lang.String newName, java.util.Set<java.lang.String> allPassageNames) throws InvalidPassageNameException, DuplicatePassageNameException
      Deprecated.
      This method will be used when attempting to rename this passage.
      Specified by:
      renameThisPassage in interface PassageEditingInterface
      Parameters:
      newName - the new name that the user is trying to give this passage.
      allPassageNames - the set of all passage names
      Returns:
      the previous name of this passage (before it got renamed)
      Throws:
      InvalidPassageNameException - if the passage name isn't a valid passage name
      DuplicatePassageNameException - if there's already a passage with this name which exists

    • renameThisPassage

      public java.util.Map<java.util.UUID,​PassageEditingInterface> renameThisPassage​(java.lang.String newName, java.util.Map<java.util.UUID,​PassageEditingInterface> allPassages) throws InvalidPassageNameException, DuplicatePassageNameException
      This method will be used when attempting to rename this passage.
      Specified by:
      renameThisPassage in interface PassageEditingInterface
      Parameters:
      newName - the new name that the user is trying to give this passage.
      allPassages - the map of all passages. Any passages with links to this passage will have their links updated to point to the new name of this passage, assuming that this passage is successfully renamed.
      Returns:
      the updated copy of allPassages
      Throws:
      InvalidPassageNameException - if the passage name isn't a valid passage name
      DuplicatePassageNameException - if there's already a passage with this name which exists

    • updateLinkedUUIDs

      public void updateLinkedUUIDs​(java.util.Map<java.util.UUID,​? extends SharedPassage> allPassages)
      Description copied from interface: PassageEditingInterface
      Method that'll be used to update the set containing the UUIDs of all the passages that this passage is linked to. call this for each element in the map of (? extends SharedPassages) after everything's been added to it.
      Specified by:
      updateLinkedUUIDs in interface PassageEditingInterface
      Parameters:
      allPassages - the map of all passages mapped to UUIDs (where the UUIDs will be read from basically)

    • equals

      public boolean equals​(java.lang.Object obj)
      equals method. bottom text.
      Overrides:
      equals in class java.lang.Object
      Parameters:
      obj - the thing that this is being compared to. If obj is an EditablePassage, this returns true if the passageUUID of this and obj are equal. If obj is a String, this returns true if the passageName of this is the same as the string obj. Otherwise, imma just ignore what obj is and return false anyway
      Returns:
      true if it's equal, false otherwise

    • outputAsStringForDebuggingReasons

      public java.lang.String outputAsStringForDebuggingReasons()
      Outputs this passage as a string. For debugging reasons. toHecc() isn't really applicable in this situation, as that's just an abstraction of the full details of this particular object.
